Call a Read-Only (View) Function on a NEAR Smart Contract

Source: R/near_call_view_function.R
near_call_view_function.Rd

Executes a view (read-only) function on a NEAR smart contract without spending gas. Uses the query RPC method with request_type = "call_function".

Usage

near_call_view_function(
  account_id,
  method_name,
  args = list(),
  finality = c("final", "optimistic"),
  block_id = NULL
)

Arguments

account_id

Character scalar. The contract account ID (e.g. "wrap.near").

method_name

Character scalar. Name of the view function.

args

Named list of arguments (automatically JSON-encoded to base64). Use list() for no arguments.

finality

Block finality: "final" (default & safest) or "optimistic" (faster).

block_id

Optional specific block height (integer) or hash (character). Cannot be used together with finality.

Value

A tibble with one row containing:

account_id, method_name

echo of inputs

result_raw

raw bytes as raw vector (list-column)

result_text

UTF-8 decoded string (or NA)

result_json

parsed JSON object (or NULL if not valid JSON)

logs

contract logs

block_height, block_hash

context of the call

raw_response

complete RPC response for debugging

See also

https://docs.near.org/api/rpc/contracts#call-a-contract-function-view

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
near_set_endpoint("mainnet")

# Simple getter
near_call_view_function("wrap.near", "ft_total_supply")

# With arguments
near_call_view_function(
  "wrap.near",
  "ft_balance_of",
  args = list(account_id = "sawsimeon.near")
)


# Ref Finance example
near_call_view_function("v2.ref-finance.near", "get_pool", args = list(pool_id = 513))

# Historical view at a specific block
near_call_view_function(
  "wrap.near",
  "ft_balance_of",
  args = list(account_id = "vitalik.near"),
  block_id = 80000000
)
} # }
